resources.string:
Download spam numbers from %s and import them into local database.

The workflow runs daily, it downloads the entire list on the first run, then performs only incremental updates on all subsequent runs.
Workflow not saved, save it first.

Save a tag value to reuse it in future workflow runs.

It\'s tied to the workflow and will be automatically deleted when the workflow is deleted.

Use case:
  In scenarios involving incremental updates, a pointer-like variable must be saved and reused across successive runs.
Load a tag that was saved earlier.

Extract content from the previous step and store it in a custom tag for reuse in subsequent steps.

Options

Parse Type
Parse the tag value, it supports regex and xpath.

Tag Name
The tag name to generate.
For example, if the tag name is my_token, then you can use {my_token} in subsequent HTTP queries.
Exporting %s numbers from the database, this might take around %s seconds.

Highlight the timestamp in different colors based on how recent the record is.

Use case:
  Review today\'s calls at night by checking all records with a blue timestamp.
Must be either today or a number followed by min (e.g. 5min, 120min)
Invalid value, see the tooltip for help

Each filter has its priority value, as the term implies, it dictates the order in which the call is checked.

By Default,

- Whitelist rules have priority 10
  E.g. Contacts, RepeatedCall, RecentApps, etc

- Blacklist rules have priority 0
  E.g. STIR, Database, etc

When they are both enabled, whitelist rules will override blacklist rules as 10 > 0.

For regex rules, the priority can be set to any number between -2147483648 and 2147483647.
Different rules can have the same priority as long as they are the same type, however, never assign the same priority to both whitelist and blacklist rules, it can cause random behavior.

The feature Meeting Mode has priority 20 by default, because it\'s supposed to block any calls during a meeting.
And -1 for Instant Query, so it only gets checked after the call has passed all local filters.

Use cases of customizing the priority:

- Always block a particular number, no matter if it repeats
  Set a rule with priority > 10 to override Repeated Call.

- Always allow a number
  Set it to > 20 to override Meeting Mode.

- Test a regex rule
  Set it to 999 to override all other filters so you don\'t have to temporarily disable them one by one.
